instruction: twenty names of famous horses and who they belonged to
output:
1. Secretariat - owned by Meadow Stable (Christopher Chenery and his son John)
2. Trigger - owned by Roy Rogers and the United States Army
3. Black Caviar - owned by the Natasha Boudot and the retired jockey Luke Nolen
4. Seabiscuit - owned by Charles S. Howard and his son Howard B. Keighley
5. Mr. Ed - owned by Wilbur Post and the fictional character Mr. Ed
6. Pegasus - owned by Greek mythology (symbolic horse, not owned by a specific person or stable)
7. Bucephalus - owned by Alexander the Great
8. Black Beauty - owned by various characters in the novel by Anna Sewell
9. Phar Lap - owned by Harry Telford and David Davis
10. Red Rum - owned by Noel le Mare and the National Trust
11. Affirmed - owned by Louis Wolfson
12. Citation - owned by Calumet Farm
13. American Pharoah - owned by Ahmed Zayat and Bob Baffert
14. Whinny - owned by various people in the novel "The Horse Whisperer" by Nicholas Evans
15. Silver - owned by Rooster and Little Joe in the television series "Bonanza"
16. Winning Post - owned by the characters in the Japanese anime "Silver Spoon"
17. Secretariat - owned by the Disney movie "Secretariat"
18. Black Stallion - owned by the fictional character Henry Dailey and various characters in the novels and movies
19. Trigger - owned by Roy Rogers and Dale Evans
20. Invictus - owned by the character William Wallace in the movie "Braveheart"

Please note that some of these horses are fictional or from mythology, and the ownership information is based on the stories or movies they appear in.
